docs.text:
Welcome to MkDocs


For full documentation visit 
mkdocs.org
.


Commands




mkdocs new [dir-name]
 - Create a new project.


mkdocs serve
 - Start the live-reloading docs server.


mkdocs build
 - Build the documentation site.


mkdocs help
 - Print this help message.




Project layout


mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Get Started

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name]  - Create a new project.  mkdocs serve  - Start the live-reloading docs server.  mkdocs build  - Build the documentation site.  mkdocs help  - Print this help message.
docs.title: Commands

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text:
Creating a new Telegram Bot


Log in to your Telegram account and go to 
https://telegram.me/botfather
. You will be directed to the 
web version
. For a first time conversation with the BotFather click 
Start
 to continue. Your screen should now look like this:




Select 
/newbot
 to continue


Type your bot name and submit




You will be prompted to add bot username. Fill in as shown below




Copy the 
Token


We'll use this to setup with PesaBot




Add your Token to PesaBot


Open the integration area and find telegram. See screenshots below




Select Telegram




Finally Paste your 
Token
 to complete set. Make sure the 
Enable
 flag is selected.




Test your Bot


Search for the bot




Cogratulation. Your Telegram is up. You can now start chating with it and share to the world.
docs.title: Telegram

docs.text: Log in to your Telegram account and go to  https://telegram.me/botfather . You will be directed to the  web version . For a first time conversation with the BotFather click  Start  to continue. Your screen should now look like this:   Select  /newbot  to continue  Type your bot name and submit   You will be prompted to add bot username. Fill in as shown below   Copy the  Token  We'll use this to setup with PesaBot
docs.title: Creating a new Telegram Bot

docs.text: Open the integration area and find telegram. See screenshots below   Select Telegram   Finally Paste your  Token  to complete set. Make sure the  Enable  flag is selected.
docs.title: Add your Token to PesaBot

docs.text: Search for the bot   Cogratulation. Your Telegram is up. You can now start chating with it and share to the world.
docs.title: Test your Bot

docs.text:
Creating a Bot in Skype


Log in to the Microsoft Dev Center and register a new bot: 
https://dev.botframework.com/bots/new


Provide a name, bot handle, and description in the Bot profile section:




In the Configuration section, add 
https://yourapp.pesabot.com/chatbot
. Be sure to change 
yourapp
 with your actual app subdomain name.


Click the 
Create Microsoft App ID and password
 button.




On the new page that will open, click the 
Generate a password to continue
 button:




A pop-up with a new password will appear. Copy this password for use in the next step.




Go back to the Skype bot settings and fill in the information in the Publisher profile section and click 'Register'.




Add Skype to PesaBot


Click 
Integrations
 link to open the integration page. Select to configure Skype as shown:




Add your BotHandle, the AppId and the Password you copied as shown below:




Click 
Save Changes
 button and make sure the enable flag is set.


Test your Skype Bot


After clicking on 'Register' in your Skype bot settings, you'll see a list of channels you can connect to.


Then, click on 
Skype
 to setup the Skype channel.




On the opened page, click 
Add to Contacts
.




Open Skype and search for your Bot by name and begin conversation.
docs.title: Skype

docs.text: Log in to the Microsoft Dev Center and register a new bot:  https://dev.botframework.com/bots/new  Provide a name, bot handle, and description in the Bot profile section:   In the Configuration section, add  https://yourapp.pesabot.com/chatbot . Be sure to change  yourapp  with your actual app subdomain name.  Click the  Create Microsoft App ID and password  button.   On the new page that will open, click the  Generate a password to continue  button:   A pop-up with a new password will appear. Copy this password for use in the next step.   Go back to the Skype bot settings and fill in the information in the Publisher profile section and click 'Register'.
docs.title: Creating a Bot in Skype

docs.text: Click  Integrations  link to open the integration page. Select to configure Skype as shown:   Add your BotHandle, the AppId and the Password you copied as shown below:   Click  Save Changes  button and make sure the enable flag is set.
docs.title: Add Skype to PesaBot

docs.text: After clicking on 'Register' in your Skype bot settings, you'll see a list of channels you can connect to.  Then, click on  Skype  to setup the Skype channel.   On the opened page, click  Add to Contacts .   Open Skype and search for your Bot by name and begin conversation.
docs.title: Test your Skype Bot

docs.text:
About


PesaBot is a framework for businesses to create and manage ChatBots on the go. With PesaBot, no knowledge in coding is required.


We have designed easy to use interfaces for businesses to start configuring their bot conversation flow, build and publish chatbots.
docs.title: Support

docs.text: PesaBot is a framework for businesses to create and manage ChatBots on the go. With PesaBot, no knowledge in coding is required.  We have designed easy to use interfaces for businesses to start configuring their bot conversation flow, build and publish chatbots.
